page.title: 04ANCIENT CIRCLE, BLEASDALE
page.content:
Bleasdale Circle was a very important discovery.It dates from Bronze Age times and is about 2000 years old.It was composed of an outer and inner circle of oak logs.Around the inner circle was a ditch the floor of which was lined with parallel poles.
In the centre of the inner circle were buried two funeral urns which contained burnt human bones.Inside one of the urns was a small pigmy cup. The circle lies in the centre of a peat moss known as Edmarsh or Admarsh.
It was discovered in 1896 by a farmer, Thomas Kelsall.
Some of the oak posts and the urns are in the Harris Museum,Preston. The positions of the posts are now marked by concrete posts.
